__e: Put it on! It is not a badge of my shame, but your own!
"Badge of Justice" has the space, but I can only take a few of us.
I know. I also know that that NYPD badge of yours doesn't mean squat here.
If you come in, I need you to leave your badge at the door.
If you want to see your badge again, listen very carefully.
You may have gotten your badge back, but you still have to work for it.
No, what you ought to do is give me a gun and a badge and let me do what I'm good at.
She doesn't know what she's talking about, 'cause if I was really a cop, I would have a badge and a gun, and I don't... - I don't have either.
But what I do know is that to do this job, sometimes you've got to take off these badges and get bloody.
But no. Isn't it sad that a man has to hide behind a badge just to stand up to his old man?
I don't know about you. I don't need a badge to finish this.
I only asked you questions. Yeah, right. You used your badge to get into my house, and then you tried to touch me.
AL. Just 'cause he wearing a badge doesn't mean he won't shoot one.
Just 'cause you have a badge doesn't mean you can treat people any way you like.
Yes, that's the w, but the money and the badge are not the law.
But she's smart enough to leave her badge at the door.
You thought my dad's badge was his heart, remember? No. I don't.
You have my dad's police badge, and I want it back.
